allergen-free.chunkedData:
"I like the natural scent of this toilet spray which has no chemical odor to it.  

The ingredients are identified as vanilla oil, lemon oil, and lavender oil.  

Since this is spritzed into the toilet bowl, the smell wafts up nicely as I sit there.  

The downside of using this spray is it has to be squirted into the toilet bowl for 3 to 5 sprays plus shaken before that.  

Quite frankly sometimes when you got to go, you got to go so using this takes some valuable seconds to do that.
allergen-free.reviewText: "I like the natural scent of this toilet spray which has no chemical odor to it.  The ingredients are identified as vanilla oil, lemon oil, and lavender oil.  Since this is spritzed into the toilet bowl, the smell wafts up nicely as I sit there.  The downside of using this spray is it has to be squirted into the toilet bowl for 3 to 5 sprays plus shaken before that.  Quite frankly sometimes when you got to go, you got to go so using this takes some valuable seconds to do that.  Such situations can be the times when odor control is most needed.  For other more regular times, the process for using this toilet spray is fine.  Its also possible that visitors wont take the time to read the instructions on how to use this.  This package includes 2 toilet spray bottles.  My rating is 3 stars for although I like the way this smells, it takes too long to use."

The bottles are a decent size, but the sprayers are kind of finicky. I read other reviews and had some concern.

But I decided to try this brand to see if the savings were too good to pass up., First things first, shipping was fine, no leakage.

However once I started using the product as directed the fragrance does leak from the sprayer when being used or when you shake it as directed.

If you choose not to shake, you don’t have any leaks.

However the fragrance is finished to the point where the product isn’t effective.
allergen-free.reviewText: I read other reviews and had some concern. But I decided to try this brand to see if the savings were too good to pass up., First things first, shipping was fine, no leakage. However once I started using the product as directed the fragrance does leak from the sprayer when being used or when you shake it as directed. If you choose not to shake, you don’t have any leaks. However the fragrance is finished to the point where the product isn’t effective. This is most likely due to the oils and water separating between visits., Overall the spray fragrance is pleasant but doesn’t do as good of a job as some other more expensive competitors., I won’t be re-ordering from this brand unless something dramatically changes. I’ll be sticking with the leader in this category for my next purchase.

But even still, it does do a great job covering up bad odors.

allergen-free.reviewText: I ordered this toilet spray in the “Vanilla” scent and the combination of vanilla oil, lemon oil, and lavender oil smells like a generic artificial tropical scent that is commonly used in public bathrooms. Kind of fake smelling with just a hint of janitorial cleaner mixed in. It’s not bad, just not exactly what I was expecting for something labeled as vanilla. The bottles are a decent size, but the sprayers are kind of finicky. This spray also has a tendency to billow in the air, up onto the toilet seat and onto the backside of whoever is on the toilet seat. Leaving an oily residue behind. Not really a fan of that, as I have very sensitive skin and a sensitive vaginal pH. So I resorted to spraying this spray in the toilet right after a BM. It actually works great that way. It stops the smells immediately and leaves behind a very pleasant scent in my bathroom.

allergen-free.reviewText: "I like the natural scent of this toilet spray which has no chemical odor to it.  The ingredients are identified as vanilla oil, lemon oil, and lavender oil.  Since this is spritzed into the toilet bowl, the smell wafts up nicely as I sit there.  The downside of using this spray is it has to be squirted into the toilet bowl for 3 to 5 sprays plus shaken before that.  Quite frankly sometimes when you got to go, you got to go so using this takes some valuable seconds to do that.  Such situations can be the times when odor control is most needed.  For other more regular times, the process for using this toilet spray is fine.  Its also possible that visitors wont take the time to read the instructions on how to use this.  This package includes 2 toilet spray bottles.  My rating is 3 stars for although I like the way this smells, it takes too long to use."

Those bottles worked well when used in the horizontal position, or facing slightly downward.  The Natural Spray Before You Go bottle does not work well in the horizontal position.  You need to shake it before use.  These two things alone make this product less desirable for me.  The idea behind these products is that they leave a film of oil on the top of the water, which keeps the odors from coming up from the bowl....but this one is more of a fragrant spray, and doesnt seem to work in that manner....its more like it covers up the other scent with its citrus fresh lemon scent.  Because of the shaking, 3-5 sprays, poor bottle spraying performance, and the fact that this is less effective for what you want it to do...Im only giving it three stars."

coverage area.reviewText: I read other reviews and had some concern. But I decided to try this brand to see if the savings were too good to pass up., First things first, shipping was fine, no leakage. However once I started using the product as directed the fragrance does leak from the sprayer when being used or when you shake it as directed. If you choose not to shake, you don’t have any leaks. However the fragrance is finished to the point where the product isn’t effective. This is most likely due to the oils and water separating between visits., Overall the spray fragrance is pleasant but doesn’t do as good of a job as some other more expensive competitors., I won’t be re-ordering from this brand unless something dramatically changes. I’ll be sticking with the leader in this category for my next purchase.

coverage area.reviewText: We usually use another well known brand of bathroom spray in our house. A large 16 ounce bottle costs just over $20 or about $1.29 per ounce. This Poo-Better Spray costs $1.85 per ounce., Poo-Better Spray is made of all natural essential oils, which is great, but the bottle comes with a warning to avoid excessive heat, fire sparks, open flame, direct sunshine rays and high temperatures. I have no idea why this warning is printed on the bottle and what will happen if expose to direct sunshine rays occurs, but this makes me a little nervous. We have a window in our bathroom., This spray does work. It does smell nice and the oils seem harmless enough - lemon, vanilla and lavender. It smells like lemon. A lot of lemon., The bottle does leak if you tip it up in the smallest amount. I often use our bathroom sprays to eliminate kitchen odors, but this spray I have been more cautious with. I have been keeping it strictly in the bathroom and away from our dogs completely.

coverage area.reviewText: I ordered this toilet spray in the “Vanilla” scent and the combination of vanilla oil, lemon oil, and lavender oil smells like a generic artificial tropical scent that is commonly used in public bathrooms. The bottles are a decent size, but the sprayers are kind of finicky. This spray also has a tendency to billow in the air, up onto the toilet seat and onto the backside of whoever is on the toilet seat. Leaving an oily residue behind. Not really a fan of that, as I have very sensitive skin and a sensitive vaginal pH. So I resorted to spraying this spray in the toilet right after a BM. It actually works great that way. coverage area.reviewText: "Weve used several other products such as this that only require one or two sprays per use.  Those bottles worked well when used in the horizontal position, or facing slightly downward.  The Natural Spray Before You Go bottle does not work well in the horizontal position.  You need to shake it before use.  These two things alone make this product less desirable for me.  The idea behind these products is that they leave a film of oil on the top of the water, which keeps the odors from coming up from the bowl....but this one is more of a fragrant spray, and doesnt seem to work in that manner....its more like it covers up the other scent with its citrus fresh lemon scent.  Because of the shaking, 3-5 sprays, poor bottle spraying performance, and the fact that this is less effective for what you want it to do...Im only giving it three stars."

coverage area.reviewText: We usually use another well known brand of bathroom spray in our house. A large 16 ounce bottle costs just over $20 or about $1.29 per ounce. This Poo-Better Spray costs $1.85 per ounce., Poo-Better Spray is made of all natural essential oils, which is great, but the bottle comes with a warning to avoid excessive heat, fire sparks, open flame, direct sunshine rays and high temperatures. I have no idea why this warning is printed on the bottle and what will happen if expose to direct sunshine rays occurs, but this makes me a little nervous. We have a window in our bathroom., This spray does work. It does smell nice and the oils seem harmless enough - lemon, vanilla and lavender. It smells like lemon. A lot of lemon., The bottle does leak if you tip it up in the smallest amount. I often use our bathroom sprays to eliminate kitchen odors, but this spray I have been more cautious with. I have been keeping it strictly in the bathroom and away from our dogs completely.

coverage area.reviewText: "I like the natural scent of this toilet spray which has no chemical odor to it.  The ingredients are identified as vanilla oil, lemon oil, and lavender oil.  Since this is spritzed into the toilet bowl, the smell wafts up nicely as I sit there.  The downside of using this spray is it has to be squirted into the toilet bowl for 3 to 5 sprays plus shaken before that.  Quite frankly sometimes when you got to go, you got to go so using this takes some valuable seconds to do that.  Such situations can be the times when odor control is most needed.  For other more regular times, the process for using this toilet spray is fine.  Its also possible that visitors wont take the time to read the instructions on how to use this.  This package includes 2 toilet spray bottles.  My rating is 3 stars for although I like the way this smells, it takes too long to use."

coverage area.reviewText: I ordered this toilet spray in the “Vanilla” scent and the combination of vanilla oil, lemon oil, and lavender oil smells like a generic artificial tropical scent that is commonly used in public bathrooms. Kind of fake smelling with just a hint of janitorial cleaner mixed in. It’s not bad, just not exactly what I was expecting for something labeled as vanilla. The bottles are a decent size, but the sprayers are kind of finicky. This spray also has a tendency to billow in the air, up onto the toilet seat and onto the backside of whoever is on the toilet seat. Leaving an oily residue behind. Not really a fan of that, as I have very sensitive skin and a sensitive vaginal pH. So I resorted to spraying this spray in the toilet right after a BM. It actually works great that way. It stops the smells immediately and leaves behind a very pleasant scent in my bathroom.

I ordered this toilet spray in the “Vanilla” scent and the combination of vanilla oil, lemon oil, and lavender oil smells like a generic artificial tropical scent that is commonly used in public bathrooms.

coverage area.reviewText: I ordered this toilet spray in the “Vanilla” scent and the combination of vanilla oil, lemon oil, and lavender oil smells like a generic artificial tropical scent that is commonly used in public bathrooms. Kind of fake smelling with just a hint of janitorial cleaner mixed in. It’s not bad, just not exactly what I was expecting for something labeled as vanilla. The bottles are a decent size, but the sprayers are kind of finicky. This spray also has a tendency to billow in the air, up onto the toilet seat and onto the backside of whoever is on the toilet seat. Leaving an oily residue behind. Not really a fan of that, as I have very sensitive skin and a sensitive vaginal pH. So I resorted to spraying this spray in the toilet right after a BM. It actually works great that way. It stops the smells immediately and leaves behind a very pleasant scent in my bathroom.

The scent is not overwhelming, but eliminates almost all of the bad odor.

coverage area.reviewText: My husband and I both have different medical conditions that can make going #2 in public very embarrassing, but thanks to this product we have been saved from that embarrassment!!! I highly recommend this to everyone and anyone who is uncomfortable using the bathroom in public due to the odor that is left behind!!!!!

"I like the natural scent of this toilet spray which has no chemical odor to it.  

The ingredients are identified as vanilla oil, lemon oil, and lavender oil.  

Since this is spritzed into the toilet bowl, the smell wafts up nicely as I sit there.  

The downside of using this spray is it has to be squirted into the toilet bowl for 3 to 5 sprays plus shaken before that.  

Quite frankly sometimes when you got to go, you got to go so using this takes some valuable seconds to do that.

The product does a decent job of odor suppression, but the dispenser is terrible.

The pump mechanism is not designed for use in the horizontal position (how else do you aim the spray into the bowl), and it leaks.  

Sometimes it works well, but most of the time it needs to be primed in the upright position.  

I think a dispenser with a trigger would be much more advantageous., UPDATE:  

The seller read my review and reached out to me with a refund and an apology for my dissatisfaction.

"Weve used several other products such as this that only require one or two sprays per use.  

Those bottles worked well when used in the horizontal position, or facing slightly downward.  

The Natural Spray Before You Go bottle does not work well in the horizontal position.  

You need to shake it before use.  

These two things alone make this product less desirable for me.
dispensing mechanism.reviewText: "Weve used several other products such as this that only require one or two sprays per use.  Those bottles worked well when used in the horizontal position, or facing slightly downward.  The Natural Spray Before You Go bottle does not work well in the horizontal position.  You need to shake it before use.  These two things alone make this product less desirable for me.  The idea behind these products is that they leave a film of oil on the top of the water, which keeps the odors from coming up from the bowl....but this one is more of a fragrant spray, and doesnt seem to work in that manner....its more like it covers up the other scent with its citrus fresh lemon scent.  Because of the shaking, 3-5 sprays, poor bottle spraying performance, and the fact that this is less effective for what you want it to do...Im only giving it three stars."

Product works by covering the top of the toilet water with a film of good smelling essential oils, keeping the smell of your poo below the water.  

Problem is when you take a Jurassic Park sized bam

and it piles up past the top of the water, it renders this product useless., "My wife told me I cant poop in our house anymore.  

I have to go to the local Dunkin donuts now."

dispensing mechanism.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars, Works good for small to medium BM

dispensing mechanism.chunkedData:
The Natural Spray Before You Go bottle does not work well in the horizontal position.  

You need to shake it before use.  

These two things alone make this product less desirable for me.  

The idea behind these products is that they leave a film of oil on the top of the water, which keeps the odors from coming up from the bowl....

but this one is more of a fragrant spray, and doesnt seem to work in that manner....
dispensing mechanism.reviewText: "Weve used several other products such as this that only require one or two sprays per use.  Those bottles worked well when used in the horizontal position, or facing slightly downward.  The Natural Spray Before You Go bottle does not work well in the horizontal position.  You need to shake it before use.  These two things alone make this product less desirable for me.  The idea behind these products is that they leave a film of oil on the top of the water, which keeps the odors from coming up from the bowl....but this one is more of a fragrant spray, and doesnt seem to work in that manner....its more like it covers up the other scent with its citrus fresh lemon scent.  Because of the shaking, 3-5 sprays, poor bottle spraying performance, and the fact that this is less effective for what you want it to do...Im only giving it three stars."
dispensing mechanism.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars, "Lemon Scent, Nice Bottle, but Doesnt Spray Well Inverted"

dispensing mechanism.chunkedData:
This spray works well but you need an extra pump or two.

The flower sent is pretty strong but it does eliminate the order.

You get 2 in the box so it will last a while if your not too spray happy.

3-4 sprays is plenty of not you will choke on the flower scent.

Good product

but I may try a different smell next to round.

The product itself is good.

It smells nice and does what it’s supposed to do.

The spray nozzle is useless.

I ended up buying a small empty spray bottle from the W store for a buck and I poured the liquid into that instead.

It works great now.

"I received this product and of course was excited to try it.

It does trap the odor and smells lovely.

However, the only problem is when I spray it in the toilet I find that a mist rises up and gets onto the toilet seat.

So after you spray you have to wipe the seat or else the seat is damp with the product.

Wish that the product wouldnt mist like it does, but otherwise it is good and I like it because it does the job it is intended to do."

dispensing mechanism.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars, Eh...

dispensing mechanism.chunkedData:
"I like the natural scent of this toilet spray which has no chemical odor to it.  

The ingredients are identified as vanilla oil, lemon oil, and lavender oil.  

Since this is spritzed into the toilet bowl, the smell wafts up nicely as I sit there.  

The downside of using this spray is it has to be squirted into the toilet bowl for 3 to 5 sprays plus shaken before that.  

Quite frankly sometimes when you got to go, you got to go so using this takes some valuable seconds to do that.
dispensing mechanism.reviewText: "I like the natural scent of this toilet spray which has no chemical odor to it.  The ingredients are identified as vanilla oil, lemon oil, and lavender oil.  Since this is spritzed into the toilet bowl, the smell wafts up nicely as I sit there.  The downside of using this spray is it has to be squirted into the toilet bowl for 3 to 5 sprays plus shaken before that.  Quite frankly sometimes when you got to go, you got to go so using this takes some valuable seconds to do that.  Such situations can be the times when odor control is most needed.  For other more regular times, the process for using this toilet spray is fine.  Its also possible that visitors wont take the time to read the instructions on how to use this.  This package includes 2 toilet spray bottles.  My rating is 3 stars for although I like the way this smells, it takes too long to use."

dispensing mechanism.chunkedData:
It’s not bad, just not exactly what I was expecting for something labeled as vanilla.

The bottles are a decent size, but the sprayers are kind of finicky.

This spray also has a tendency to billow in the air, up onto the toilet seat and onto the backside of whoever is on the toilet seat.

Leaving an oily residue behind.

Not really a fan of that, as I have very sensitive skin and a sensitive vaginal pH.

So I resorted to spraying this spray in the toilet right after a BM.
dispensing mechanism.reviewText: I ordered this toilet spray in the “Vanilla” scent and the combination of vanilla oil, lemon oil, and lavender oil smells like a generic artificial tropical scent that is commonly used in public bathrooms. Kind of fake smelling with just a hint of janitorial cleaner mixed in. It’s not bad, just not exactly what I was expecting for something labeled as vanilla. The bottles are a decent size, but the sprayers are kind of finicky. This spray also has a tendency to billow in the air, up onto the toilet seat and onto the backside of whoever is on the toilet seat. Leaving an oily residue behind. Not really a fan of that, as I have very sensitive skin and a sensitive vaginal pH. So I resorted to spraying this spray in the toilet right after a BM. It actually works great that way. It stops the smells immediately and leaves behind a very pleasant scent in my bathroom.
dispensing mechanism.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars, Public bathroom artificial tropical scent.

dispensing mechanism.chunkedData:
We usually use another well known brand of bathroom spray in our house.

A large 16 ounce bottle costs just over $20 or about $1.29 per ounce.

This Poo-Better Spray costs $1.85 per ounce., Poo-Better Spray is made of all natural essential oils, which is great, but the bottle comes with a warning to avoid excessive heat, fire sparks, open flame, direct sunshine rays and high temperatures.
dispensing mechanism.reviewText: We usually use another well known brand of bathroom spray in our house. A large 16 ounce bottle costs just over $20 or about $1.29 per ounce. This Poo-Better Spray costs $1.85 per ounce., Poo-Better Spray is made of all natural essential oils, which is great, but the bottle comes with a warning to avoid excessive heat, fire sparks, open flame, direct sunshine rays and high temperatures. I have no idea why this warning is printed on the bottle and what will happen if expose to direct sunshine rays occurs, but this makes me a little nervous. We have a window in our bathroom., This spray does work. It does smell nice and the oils seem harmless enough - lemon, vanilla and lavender. It smells like lemon. A lot of lemon., The bottle does leak if you tip it up in the smallest amount. I often use our bathroom sprays to eliminate kitchen odors, but this spray I have been more cautious with. I have been keeping it strictly in the bathroom and away from our dogs completely.

It does help.

Not 100% effective, but maybe 80%.

And the smell is pleasant and naturally fragrant.,

My only issue with it is that the formula is on the thin side, so you have to spray a lot more of it compared to brands like Poo-pourri.

dispensing mechanism.chunkedData:
I ordered this toilet spray in the “Vanilla” scent and the combination of vanilla oil, lemon oil, and lavender oil smells like a generic artificial tropical scent that is commonly used in public bathrooms.

Kind of fake smelling with just a hint of janitorial cleaner mixed in.

dispensing mechanism.reviewText: I ordered this toilet spray in the “Vanilla” scent and the combination of vanilla oil, lemon oil, and lavender oil smells like a generic artificial tropical scent that is commonly used in public bathrooms. Kind of fake smelling with just a hint of janitorial cleaner mixed in. It’s not bad, just not exactly what I was expecting for something labeled as vanilla. The bottles are a decent size, but the sprayers are kind of finicky. This spray also has a tendency to billow in the air, up onto the toilet seat and onto the backside of whoever is on the toilet seat. Leaving an oily residue behind. Not really a fan of that, as I have very sensitive skin and a sensitive vaginal pH. So I resorted to spraying this spray in the toilet right after a BM. It actually works great that way. It stops the smells immediately and leaves behind a very pleasant scent in my bathroom.

We have a window in our bathroom., This spray does work. It does smell nice and the oils seem harmless enough - lemon, vanilla and lavender. It smells like lemon. fragrance intensity.reviewText: "Weve used several other products such as this that only require one or two sprays per use.  Those bottles worked well when used in the horizontal position, or facing slightly downward.  The Natural Spray Before You Go bottle does not work well in the horizontal position.  You need to shake it before use.  These two things alone make this product less desirable for me.  The idea behind these products is that they leave a film of oil on the top of the water, which keeps the odors from coming up from the bowl....but this one is more of a fragrant spray, and doesnt seem to work in that manner....its more like it covers up the other scent with its citrus fresh lemon scent.  Because of the shaking, 3-5 sprays, poor bottle spraying performance, and the fact that this is less effective for what you want it to do...Im only giving it three stars."

Since this is spritzed into the toilet bowl, the smell wafts up nicely as I sit there.  The downside of using this spray is it has to be squirted into the toilet bowl for 3 to 5 sprays plus shaken before that.  Quite frankly sometimes when you got to go, you got to go so using this takes some valuable seconds to do that.  Such situations can be the times when odor control is most needed.  For other more regular times, the process for using this toilet spray is fine.  Its also possible that visitors wont take the time to read the instructions on how to use this.  This package includes 2 toilet spray bottles.  My rating is 3 stars for although I like the way this smells, it takes too long to use."

fragrance intensity.reviewText: I ordered this toilet spray in the “Vanilla” scent and the combination of vanilla oil, lemon oil, and lavender oil smells like a generic artificial tropical scent that is commonly used in public bathrooms. Kind of fake smelling with just a hint of janitorial cleaner mixed in. It’s not bad, just not exactly what I was expecting for something labeled as vanilla. The bottles are a decent size, but the sprayers are kind of finicky. Those bottles worked well when used in the horizontal position, or facing slightly downward.  The Natural Spray Before You Go bottle does not work well in the horizontal position.  You need to shake it before use.  These two things alone make this product less desirable for me.  The idea behind these products is that they leave a film of oil on the top of the water, which keeps the odors from coming up from the bowl....but this one is more of a fragrant spray, and doesnt seem to work in that manner....its more like it covers up the other scent with its citrus fresh lemon scent.  Because of the shaking, 3-5 sprays, poor bottle spraying performance, and the fact that this is less effective for what you want it to do...Im only giving it three stars."

fragrance intensity.reviewText: "I like the natural scent of this toilet spray which has no chemical odor to it.  The ingredients are identified as vanilla oil, lemon oil, and lavender oil.  Since this is spritzed into the toilet bowl, the smell wafts up nicely as I sit there.  The downside of using this spray is it has to be squirted into the toilet bowl for 3 to 5 sprays plus shaken before that.  Quite frankly sometimes when you got to go, you got to go so using this takes some valuable seconds to do that.  Such situations can be the times when odor control is most needed.  For other more regular times, the process for using this toilet spray is fine.  Its also possible that visitors wont take the time to read the instructions on how to use this.  This package includes 2 toilet spray bottles.  My rating is 3 stars for although I like the way this smells, it takes too long to use."

fragrance intensity.reviewText: We usually use another well known brand of bathroom spray in our house. A large 16 ounce bottle costs just over $20 or about $1.29 per ounce. This Poo-Better Spray costs $1.85 per ounce., Poo-Better Spray is made of all natural essential oils, which is great, but the bottle comes with a warning to avoid excessive heat, fire sparks, open flame, direct sunshine rays and high temperatures. I have no idea why this warning is printed on the bottle and what will happen if expose to direct sunshine rays occurs, but this makes me a little nervous. We have a window in our bathroom., This spray does work. It does smell nice and the oils seem harmless enough - lemon, vanilla and lavender. It smells like lemon. A lot of lemon., The bottle does leak if you tip it up in the smallest amount. I often use our bathroom sprays to eliminate kitchen odors, but this spray I have been more cautious with. I have been keeping it strictly in the bathroom and away from our dogs completely.

lasting power.reviewText: I ordered this toilet spray in the “Vanilla” scent and the combination of vanilla oil, lemon oil, and lavender oil smells like a generic artificial tropical scent that is commonly used in public bathrooms. Kind of fake smelling with just a hint of janitorial cleaner mixed in. It’s not bad, just not exactly what I was expecting for something labeled as vanilla. The bottles are a decent size, but the sprayers are kind of finicky. This spray also has a tendency to billow in the air, up onto the toilet seat and onto the backside of whoever is on the toilet seat. Leaving an oily residue behind. Not really a fan of that, as I have very sensitive skin and a sensitive vaginal pH. So I resorted to spraying this spray in the toilet right after a BM. It actually works great that way. It stops the smells immediately and leaves behind a very pleasant scent in my bathroom.

lasting power.reviewText: "I like the natural scent of this toilet spray which has no chemical odor to it.  The ingredients are identified as vanilla oil, lemon oil, and lavender oil.  Since this is spritzed into the toilet bowl, the smell wafts up nicely as I sit there.  The downside of using this spray is it has to be squirted into the toilet bowl for 3 to 5 sprays plus shaken before that.  Quite frankly sometimes when you got to go, you got to go so using this takes some valuable seconds to do that.  Such situations can be the times when odor control is most needed.  For other more regular times, the process for using this toilet spray is fine.  Its also possible that visitors wont take the time to read the instructions on how to use this.  This package includes 2 toilet spray bottles.  My rating is 3 stars for although I like the way this smells, it takes too long to use."

lasting power.reviewText: "Weve used several other products such as this that only require one or two sprays per use.  Those bottles worked well when used in the horizontal position, or facing slightly downward.  The Natural Spray Before You Go bottle does not work well in the horizontal position.  You need to shake it before use.  These two things alone make this product less desirable for me.  The idea behind these products is that they leave a film of oil on the top of the water, which keeps the odors from coming up from the bowl....but this one is more of a fragrant spray, and doesnt seem to work in that manner....its more like it covers up the other scent with its citrus fresh lemon scent.  Because of the shaking, 3-5 sprays, poor bottle spraying performance, and the fact that this is less effective for what you want it to do...Im only giving it three stars."

Not 100% effective, but maybe 80%.

My only issue with it is that the formula is on the thin side, so you have to spray a lot more of it compared to brands like Poo-pourri.

lasting power.chunkedData:
It’s not bad, just not exactly what I was expecting for something labeled as vanilla.

The bottles are a decent size, but the sprayers are kind of finicky.

This spray also has a tendency to billow in the air, up onto the toilet seat and onto the backside of whoever is on the toilet seat.

Leaving an oily residue behind.

Not really a fan of that, as I have very sensitive skin and a sensitive vaginal pH.

So I resorted to spraying this spray in the toilet right after a BM.
lasting power.reviewText: I ordered this toilet spray in the “Vanilla” scent and the combination of vanilla oil, lemon oil, and lavender oil smells like a generic artificial tropical scent that is commonly used in public bathrooms. Kind of fake smelling with just a hint of janitorial cleaner mixed in. It’s not bad, just not exactly what I was expecting for something labeled as vanilla. The bottles are a decent size, but the sprayers are kind of finicky. This spray also has a tendency to billow in the air, up onto the toilet seat and onto the backside of whoever is on the toilet seat. Leaving an oily residue behind. Not really a fan of that, as I have very sensitive skin and a sensitive vaginal pH. So I resorted to spraying this spray in the toilet right after a BM. It actually works great that way. It stops the smells immediately and leaves behind a very pleasant scent in my bathroom.

But I decided to try this brand to see if the savings were too good to pass up., First things first, shipping was fine, no leakage.

However once I started using the product as directed the fragrance does leak from the sprayer when being used or when you shake it as directed.

If you choose not to shake, you don’t have any leaks.

However the fragrance is finished to the point where the product isn’t effective.

lasting power.reviewText: We usually use another well known brand of bathroom spray in our house. A large 16 ounce bottle costs just over $20 or about $1.29 per ounce. This Poo-Better Spray costs $1.85 per ounce., Poo-Better Spray is made of all natural essential oils, which is great, but the bottle comes with a warning to avoid excessive heat, fire sparks, open flame, direct sunshine rays and high temperatures. I have no idea why this warning is printed on the bottle and what will happen if expose to direct sunshine rays occurs, but this makes me a little nervous. We have a window in our bathroom., This spray does work. It does smell nice and the oils seem harmless enough - lemon, vanilla and lavender. It smells like lemon. A lot of lemon., The bottle does leak if you tip it up in the smallest amount. I often use our bathroom sprays to eliminate kitchen odors, but this spray I have been more cautious with. I have been keeping it strictly in the bathroom and away from our dogs completely.

lasting power.chunkedData:
The Natural Spray Before You Go bottle does not work well in the horizontal position.  

You need to shake it before use.  

These two things alone make this product less desirable for me.  

The idea behind these products is that they leave a film of oil on the top of the water, which keeps the odors from coming up from the bowl....

but this one is more of a fragrant spray, and doesnt seem to work in that manner....
lasting power.reviewText: "Weve used several other products such as this that only require one or two sprays per use.  Those bottles worked well when used in the horizontal position, or facing slightly downward.  The Natural Spray Before You Go bottle does not work well in the horizontal position.  You need to shake it before use.  These two things alone make this product less desirable for me.  The idea behind these products is that they leave a film of oil on the top of the water, which keeps the odors from coming up from the bowl....but this one is more of a fragrant spray, and doesnt seem to work in that manner....its more like it covers up the other scent with its citrus fresh lemon scent.  Because of the shaking, 3-5 sprays, poor bottle spraying performance, and the fact that this is less effective for what you want it to do...Im only giving it three stars."

lasting power.reviewText: I ordered this toilet spray in the “Vanilla” scent and the combination of vanilla oil, lemon oil, and lavender oil smells like a generic artificial tropical scent that is commonly used in public bathrooms. Kind of fake smelling with just a hint of janitorial cleaner mixed in. It’s not bad, just not exactly what I was expecting for something labeled as vanilla. The bottles are a decent size, but the sprayers are kind of finicky. This spray also has a tendency to billow in the air, up onto the toilet seat and onto the backside of whoever is on the toilet seat. Leaving an oily residue behind. Not really a fan of that, as I have very sensitive skin and a sensitive vaginal pH. So I resorted to spraying this spray in the toilet right after a BM. It actually works great that way. It stops the smells immediately and leaves behind a very pleasant scent in my bathroom.

I have no idea why this warning is printed on the bottle and what will happen if expose to direct sunshine rays occurs, but this makes me a little nervous. We have a window in our bathroom., This spray does work. It does smell nice and the oils seem harmless enough - lemon, vanilla and lavender. It smells like lemon. Its cheaper, and gets decent reviews, so I decided to try it.

Its DEFINITELY NOT LIKE POOPOURRI.

The scent is very weak, unlike PooPourri- when you spray PooPourri in the toilet the scent stays in the bathroom for a long period of time.

I like to use these after using the restroom, too.

It makes you bathroom smell nice.

This one does not do that.

The scent is barely noticeable.

non-staining formula.chunkedData:
I read other reviews and had some concern.

But I decided to try this brand to see if the savings were too good to pass up., First things first, shipping was fine, no leakage.

However once I started using the product as directed the fragrance does leak from the sprayer when being used or when you shake it as directed.

If you choose not to shake, you don’t have any leaks.

However the fragrance is finished to the point where the product isn’t effective.
non-staining formula.reviewText: I read other reviews and had some concern. But I decided to try this brand to see if the savings were too good to pass up., First things first, shipping was fine, no leakage. However once I started using the product as directed the fragrance does leak from the sprayer when being used or when you shake it as directed. If you choose not to shake, you don’t have any leaks. However the fragrance is finished to the point where the product isn’t effective. This is most likely due to the oils and water separating between visits., Overall the spray fragrance is pleasant but doesn’t do as good of a job as some other more expensive competitors., I won’t be re-ordering from this brand unless something dramatically changes. I’ll be sticking with the leader in this category for my next purchase.

My husband and I both have different medical conditions that can make going #2 in public very embarrassing, but thanks to this product we have been saved from that embarrassment!!!  

This product is as good, if not better, than the original name brand item and is so much more affordable!!!  

The scent is not overwhelming, but eliminates almost all of the bad odor.
non-staining formula.reviewText: My husband and I both have different medical conditions that can make going #2 in public very embarrassing, but thanks to this product we have been saved from that embarrassment!!!  This product is as good, if not better, than the original name brand item and is so much more affordable!!!  The scent is not overwhelming, but eliminates almost all of the bad odor.  I highly recommend this to everyone and anyone who is uncomfortable using the bathroom in public due to the odor that is left behind!!!!!
non-staining formula.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars, Embarrassment saver!!!

non-staining formula.chunkedData:
We usually use another well known brand of bathroom spray in our house.

A large 16 ounce bottle costs just over $20 or about $1.29 per ounce.

This Poo-Better Spray costs $1.85 per ounce., Poo-Better Spray is made of all natural essential oils, which is great, but the bottle comes with a warning to avoid excessive heat, fire sparks, open flame, direct sunshine rays and high temperatures.
non-staining formula.reviewText: We usually use another well known brand of bathroom spray in our house. A large 16 ounce bottle costs just over $20 or about $1.29 per ounce. This Poo-Better Spray costs $1.85 per ounce., Poo-Better Spray is made of all natural essential oils, which is great, but the bottle comes with a warning to avoid excessive heat, fire sparks, open flame, direct sunshine rays and high temperatures. I have no idea why this warning is printed on the bottle and what will happen if expose to direct sunshine rays occurs, but this makes me a little nervous. We have a window in our bathroom., This spray does work. It does smell nice and the oils seem harmless enough - lemon, vanilla and lavender. It smells like lemon. A lot of lemon., The bottle does leak if you tip it up in the smallest amount. I often use our bathroom sprays to eliminate kitchen odors, but this spray I have been more cautious with. I have been keeping it strictly in the bathroom and away from our dogs completely.
non-staining formula.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars, Works - More Expensive Then The Big Brand - Weird Warning Label

non-staining formula.chunkedData:
Its also possible that visitors wont take the time to read the instructions on how to use this.  

This package includes 2 toilet spray bottles.  

My rating is 3 stars for although I like the way this smells, it takes too long to use."
non-staining formula.reviewText: "I like the natural scent of this toilet spray which has no chemical odor to it.  The ingredients are identified as vanilla oil, lemon oil, and lavender oil.  Since this is spritzed into the toilet bowl, the smell wafts up nicely as I sit there.  The downside of using this spray is it has to be squirted into the toilet bowl for 3 to 5 sprays plus shaken before that.  Quite frankly sometimes when you got to go, you got to go so using this takes some valuable seconds to do that.  Such situations can be the times when odor control is most needed.  For other more regular times, the process for using this toilet spray is fine.  Its also possible that visitors wont take the time to read the instructions on how to use this.  This package includes 2 toilet spray bottles.  My rating is 3 stars for although I like the way this smells, it takes too long to use."
non-staining formula.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars, Sprayed Into the Toilet Bowl 3-5 Times, Then Use Toilet

non-staining formula.chunkedData:
I ordered this toilet spray in the “Vanilla” scent and the combination of vanilla oil, lemon oil, and lavender oil smells like a generic artificial tropical scent that is commonly used in public bathrooms.

Kind of fake smelling with just a hint of janitorial cleaner mixed in.

It’s not bad, just not exactly what I was expecting for something labeled as vanilla.

The bottles are a decent size, but the sprayers are kind of finicky.
non-staining formula.reviewText: I ordered this toilet spray in the “Vanilla” scent and the combination of vanilla oil, lemon oil, and lavender oil smells like a generic artificial tropical scent that is commonly used in public bathrooms. Kind of fake smelling with just a hint of janitorial cleaner mixed in. It’s not bad, just not exactly what I was expecting for something labeled as vanilla. The bottles are a decent size, but the sprayers are kind of finicky. This spray also has a tendency to billow in the air, up onto the toilet seat and onto the backside of whoever is on the toilet seat. Leaving an oily residue behind. Not really a fan of that, as I have very sensitive skin and a sensitive vaginal pH. So I resorted to spraying this spray in the toilet right after a BM. It actually works great that way. It stops the smells immediately and leaves behind a very pleasant scent in my bathroom.
non-staining formula.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars, Public bathroom artificial tropical scent.

So stupid they didnt catch this."

"I received this product and of course was excited to try it.

It does trap the odor and smells lovely.

However, the only problem is when I spray it in the toilet I find that a mist rises up and gets onto the toilet seat.

So after you spray you have to wipe the seat or else the seat is damp with the product.

Wish that the product wouldnt mist like it does, but otherwise it is good and I like it because it does the job it is intended to do."

non-staining formula.chunkedData:
"Weve used several other products such as this that only require one or two sprays per use.  

Those bottles worked well when used in the horizontal position, or facing slightly downward.  

The Natural Spray Before You Go bottle does not work well in the horizontal position.  

You need to shake it before use.  

These two things alone make this product less desirable for me.
non-staining formula.reviewText: "Weve used several other products such as this that only require one or two sprays per use.  Those bottles worked well when used in the horizontal position, or facing slightly downward.  The Natural Spray Before You Go bottle does not work well in the horizontal position.  You need to shake it before use.  These two things alone make this product less desirable for me.  The idea behind these products is that they leave a film of oil on the top of the water, which keeps the odors from coming up from the bowl....but this one is more of a fragrant spray, and doesnt seem to work in that manner....its more like it covers up the other scent with its citrus fresh lemon scent.  Because of the shaking, 3-5 sprays, poor bottle spraying performance, and the fact that this is less effective for what you want it to do...Im only giving it three stars."
non-staining formula.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars, "Lemon Scent, Nice Bottle, but Doesnt Spray Well Inverted"

"The sprayer on these is a bit inconsistent, so its hard to get a nice spray or two into the toilet.

The scent can be overpowering if you use too much, which again is easy to do since the sprayer sometimes gives a lot, or a little.

It does help mask the spray, and its nice to have since my bathroom doesnt have a window.

The bottles are a good size, and these will last a long time."

Used a old bottle from a different brand which had a much more effective spray.  

Seems to work with that.  

The eucalyptus notes are dominant and pleasant.

non-staining formula.reviewText: We usually use another well known brand of bathroom spray in our house. A large 16 ounce bottle costs just over $20 or about $1.29 per ounce. This Poo-Better Spray costs $1.85 per ounce., Poo-Better Spray is made of all natural essential oils, which is great, but the bottle comes with a warning to avoid excessive heat, fire sparks, open flame, direct sunshine rays and high temperatures. I have no idea why this warning is printed on the bottle and what will happen if expose to direct sunshine rays occurs, but this makes me a little nervous. We have a window in our bathroom., This spray does work. It does smell nice and the oils seem harmless enough - lemon, vanilla and lavender. It smells like lemon. A lot of lemon., The bottle does leak if you tip it up in the smallest amount. I often use our bathroom sprays to eliminate kitchen odors, but this spray I have been more cautious with. I have been keeping it strictly in the bathroom and away from our dogs completely.

Leaving an oily residue behind.

Not really a fan of that, as I have very sensitive skin and a sensitive vaginal pH.

So I resorted to spraying this spray in the toilet right after a BM.

It actually works great that way.

odor elimination.reviewText: I ordered this toilet spray in the “Vanilla” scent and the combination of vanilla oil, lemon oil, and lavender oil smells like a generic artificial tropical scent that is commonly used in public bathrooms. Kind of fake smelling with just a hint of janitorial cleaner mixed in. It’s not bad, just not exactly what I was expecting for something labeled as vanilla. The bottles are a decent size, but the sprayers are kind of finicky. This spray also has a tendency to billow in the air, up onto the toilet seat and onto the backside of whoever is on the toilet seat. Leaving an oily residue behind. Not really a fan of that, as I have very sensitive skin and a sensitive vaginal pH. So I resorted to spraying this spray in the toilet right after a BM. It actually works great that way. It stops the smells immediately and leaves behind a very pleasant scent in my bathroom.

odor elimination.reviewText: We usually use another well known brand of bathroom spray in our house. A large 16 ounce bottle costs just over $20 or about $1.29 per ounce. This Poo-Better Spray costs $1.85 per ounce., Poo-Better Spray is made of all natural essential oils, which is great, but the bottle comes with a warning to avoid excessive heat, fire sparks, open flame, direct sunshine rays and high temperatures. I have no idea why this warning is printed on the bottle and what will happen if expose to direct sunshine rays occurs, but this makes me a little nervous. We have a window in our bathroom., This spray does work. It does smell nice and the oils seem harmless enough - lemon, vanilla and lavender. It smells like lemon. A lot of lemon., The bottle does leak if you tip it up in the smallest amount. I often use our bathroom sprays to eliminate kitchen odors, but this spray I have been more cautious with. I have been keeping it strictly in the bathroom and away from our dogs completely.

odor elimination.reviewText: "Weve used several other products such as this that only require one or two sprays per use.  Those bottles worked well when used in the horizontal position, or facing slightly downward.  The Natural Spray Before You Go bottle does not work well in the horizontal position.  You need to shake it before use.  These two things alone make this product less desirable for me.  The idea behind these products is that they leave a film of oil on the top of the water, which keeps the odors from coming up from the bowl....but this one is more of a fragrant spray, and doesnt seem to work in that manner....its more like it covers up the other scent with its citrus fresh lemon scent.  Because of the shaking, 3-5 sprays, poor bottle spraying performance, and the fact that this is less effective for what you want it to do...Im only giving it three stars."

odor elimination.reviewText: We usually use another well known brand of bathroom spray in our house. A large 16 ounce bottle costs just over $20 or about $1.29 per ounce. This Poo-Better Spray costs $1.85 per ounce., Poo-Better Spray is made of all natural essential oils, which is great, but the bottle comes with a warning to avoid excessive heat, fire sparks, open flame, direct sunshine rays and high temperatures. I have no idea why this warning is printed on the bottle and what will happen if expose to direct sunshine rays occurs, but this makes me a little nervous. We have a window in our bathroom., This spray does work. It does smell nice and the oils seem harmless enough - lemon, vanilla and lavender. It smells like lemon. A lot of lemon., The bottle does leak if you tip it up in the smallest amount. I often use our bathroom sprays to eliminate kitchen odors, but this spray I have been more cautious with. I have been keeping it strictly in the bathroom and away from our dogs completely.

I ordered this toilet spray in the “Vanilla” scent and the combination of vanilla oil, lemon oil, and lavender oil smells like a generic artificial tropical scent that is commonly used in public bathrooms.

odor elimination.reviewText: I ordered this toilet spray in the “Vanilla” scent and the combination of vanilla oil, lemon oil, and lavender oil smells like a generic artificial tropical scent that is commonly used in public bathrooms. Kind of fake smelling with just a hint of janitorial cleaner mixed in. It’s not bad, just not exactly what I was expecting for something labeled as vanilla. The bottles are a decent size, but the sprayers are kind of finicky. This spray also has a tendency to billow in the air, up onto the toilet seat and onto the backside of whoever is on the toilet seat. Leaving an oily residue behind. Not really a fan of that, as I have very sensitive skin and a sensitive vaginal pH. So I resorted to spraying this spray in the toilet right after a BM. It actually works great that way. It stops the smells immediately and leaves behind a very pleasant scent in my bathroom.

versatility.reviewText: I ordered this toilet spray in the “Vanilla” scent and the combination of vanilla oil, lemon oil, and lavender oil smells like a generic artificial tropical scent that is commonly used in public bathrooms. The bottles are a decent size, but the sprayers are kind of finicky. This spray also has a tendency to billow in the air, up onto the toilet seat and onto the backside of whoever is on the toilet seat. Leaving an oily residue behind. Not really a fan of that, as I have very sensitive skin and a sensitive vaginal pH. So I resorted to spraying this spray in the toilet right after a BM. It actually works great that way. We usually use another well known brand of bathroom spray in our house.

A large 16 ounce bottle costs just over $20 or about $1.29 per ounce.

versatility.reviewText: We usually use another well known brand of bathroom spray in our house. A large 16 ounce bottle costs just over $20 or about $1.29 per ounce. This Poo-Better Spray costs $1.85 per ounce., Poo-Better Spray is made of all natural essential oils, which is great, but the bottle comes with a warning to avoid excessive heat, fire sparks, open flame, direct sunshine rays and high temperatures. I have no idea why this warning is printed on the bottle and what will happen if expose to direct sunshine rays occurs, but this makes me a little nervous. We have a window in our bathroom., This spray does work. It does smell nice and the oils seem harmless enough - lemon, vanilla and lavender. It smells like lemon. A lot of lemon., The bottle does leak if you tip it up in the smallest amount. I often use our bathroom sprays to eliminate kitchen odors, but this spray I have been more cautious with. versatility.reviewText: We usually use another well known brand of bathroom spray in our house. A large 16 ounce bottle costs just over $20 or about $1.29 per ounce. This Poo-Better Spray costs $1.85 per ounce., Poo-Better Spray is made of all natural essential oils, which is great, but the bottle comes with a warning to avoid excessive heat, fire sparks, open flame, direct sunshine rays and high temperatures. I have no idea why this warning is printed on the bottle and what will happen if expose to direct sunshine rays occurs, but this makes me a little nervous. We have a window in our bathroom., This spray does work. It does smell nice and the oils seem harmless enough - lemon, vanilla and lavender. It smells like lemon. A lot of lemon., The bottle does leak if you tip it up in the smallest amount. I often use our bathroom sprays to eliminate kitchen odors, but this spray I have been more cautious with. "I received this product and of course was excited to try it.

It does trap the odor and smells lovely.

However, the only problem is when I spray it in the toilet I find that a mist rises up and gets onto the toilet seat.

So after you spray you have to wipe the seat or else the seat is damp with the product.

Wish that the product wouldnt mist like it does, but otherwise it is good and I like it because it does the job it is intended to do."
